venue.name: Ashland Reservoir (Tennis Courts on Highland/Chesnut St of Warren Center/Northeastern University)

item.description:
Come meet Spark Plugge and I for our weekly off-leash play date?

When I get out of work on Saturday, I pick up my pup and run down to the Ashland Res to blow off some steam in this gigantic field with other off-leash pups and people...  both mine and Spark's social fix for the week!  If any of you would like to join me, I'd love to see you there!

There are varying numbers of dogs there at this time; there are many trails, and some dogs are leashed while some are off.  This is not a good meetup for dogs with dog-aggression.  It is great fun, with lots of running room, and friendly people!  If this is an appropriate activity (leashed or not) for you and you're pup, Spark Plugge and I would love to meet you!

Hope to see some of you there!  We've been going most Saturday evenings (between 5:30p and 6:00p), weather permitting!

Don't forget about our upcoming Whisker Walk (Sunday, June 5th...  www.whiskerwalk.org) or BayPath's Bark in the Park (Sunday, June 19th).  You can join the NEBBC Soldier Dogs to raise money for BayPath Humane Society in Hopkinton!  Visit http://www.gifttool.com/athon/MyFundraisingPage?ID=1455&AID=1543&PID=209973 to donate to the cause!

See you soon!

Cassie-Leigh Stock, President & Founder (www.nebbc.org)
item.how_to_find_us: BIG big field with tennis courts and dirt parking lot
item.name: Come meet me and Spark for our weekly off-leash play date!
